data.title: John Baptist Dirig (1877-1950)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Compare DNA and explore genealogy for John Baptist Dirig born 1877 Hagenthal, Alsace-Lorraine died 1950 Fort Wayne, Allen, Indiana, USA including ancestors + DNA connections + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
John Baptist Dirig

Born 8 Oct 1877 in Hagenthal, Alsace-Lorraine

Ancestors

Son of Frank Joseph Dirig and Marie Anna Baker

Husband of Elizabeth Rose Steiger — married 11 Jun 1902 in Fort Wayne, Allen County, Indiana, USA

[children unknown]

Died 7 Feb 1950 at age 72 in Fort Wayne, Allen, Indiana, USA

Profile last modified 13 Mar 2017

This page has been accessed 137 times.

Biography

Died 07 FEB 1950. Fort Wayne, Allen, Indiana, USA. [1]

Occupation: 1915 Helper Rub No More Company/. Peter Eckrich & Sons, Inc./. 1918 Glycerine Maker, Rub No More Co./.

Census: 06 JUN 1900. Fort Wayne, Allen Co., Wayne Township, Indiana, Ward 8, ED 45.

Religion: St. Andrew's Catholic Church/.

Event: Mortuary Getz & Cahill Funeral Home. School St. Mary's Catholic School.

Buried 10 FEB 1950. Catholic Cemetery, Fort Wayne, Indiana, Sec D, lane 396.[2]

Note: #N67.

Marriage Husband John Baptist Dirig. Wife Elizabeth Rose Steiger. Marriage 11 JUN 1902. Fort Wayne, Allen County, Indiana, USA. [3]

Notes

Note N67The Fort Wayne Journal Gazette, February 8, 1950, page 40. John B. Dirig, first employe of Peter Eckrich & Sons, Inc. and for 37 years and employe of the Rub-No-More Company, retiring as superintendent, died at 9:15 p.m. yesterday at his home, 1207 East Berry Street, after a week's illness. Mr. Dirig, a native of Germany who came to the United Stated at the age of 11, is survived by the wife, Elizabeth; six sons, Charles, Edward, George, John, Albert and Herbert, and three daughters, Mrs. Emil Vorndran, Mrs. Joseph Minnich and Mrs. Harold Weber, all of this city; 22 grandchildren; three brothers, Henry Dirig, Fort Wayne, and Alois and Anthony Dirig, in California, a and a sister, Mrs. Magdalene Poinsette, this city. Mr. Dirig attended St. Mary's Catholic School and was a member of St. Andrew's Catholic Church, its Holy Name Society and the Woodman of the World. The body was removed to the Getz & Cahill Funeral Home pending funeral arrangements.

Sources

↑ Source: #S19 February 8, 1950, page 40. The Fort Wayne Journal Gazette.

↑ Source: #S35 1940-1973 The Fort Wayne Catholic Cemetery.

↑ Source: #S177 Book 25, page 217. Fort Wayne, Allen County, Indiana.

Source: S19 obituary

Source: S35 Catholic Cemetery NOTESource Medium: Book
